body.name: Paula Deen 8.5QT (1700 Watt) Large Air Fryer, Rapid Air Circulation System, Square Single Basket System, Ceramic Non-Stick Coating, Easy-to-Use Dial, 50 Recipes (Ruby Red)
features: 8.5QT LARGE AIR FRYER - Paula Deen's air fryer features a square single basket design that allows you to cook large enough portions to feed everyone around your dinner table (4-6 people). But, with its shallow depth, this air fryer won’t take up valuable counter space in your kitchen. Square Basket dimensions: L:10 in. x W:10 in. x H: 5 in.

SIMPLE DIAL CONTROLS – The large dial controls the temperature and features large, easy-to-read temperature settings up to 430ºF. The smaller center dial controls the timer and allow up to 60 minutes of cook time. Paula has also included a handy cooking guide on the top that lists the common time and temperature settings for 10 popular air fryer needs. Including: French Fries, Wings, Pizza, Meat, Bake, Fish, Toast, Vegetable, Reheat and Keep Warm.

STAINLESS-STEEL INTERIOR – The unique stainless steel cooking chamber reflects heat to provide an even temperature throughout the cooking basket. This ensures that your food is cooked perfectly every time.

EASY TO CLEAN - Features FDA-compliant ceramic non-stick coating to make cleaning a breeze. After cooking, allow the basket to cool down and then wipe clean with a kitchen cloth or place in the top rack of the dishwasher.

SUPPORTS A HEALTHIER LIFESTYLE - Do you love crispy, crunchy, savory fried foods that are juicy and tender on the inside, but not all the fat and added calories? Then you need an air fryer. When cooking with an air fryer, you benefit from less fat and up to 85% less calories because little to no oil is used. Cook healthier food options for you and your family, such as Chicken, Steak, Pork, Fish, Root Vegetables, French Fries, Pizza, Cake.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Paula Deen 8.5QT Large Air Fryer What makes this air fryer so special is the square single basket design and rapid air circulation system, which allows for larger portions of food to be cooked at faster cooking times. Plus, its simple, easy-to-use dials make it easy to use for family members of all ages. Simply place the food in the air fryer, set the timer and temperature dials, and that’s it! Paula has also added a handy cooking guide on top that shows the most common temperatures to choose from. Once the timer goes off, your food is ready and you will find it’s crispy, juicy, and a whole lot healthier than anything cooked in a deep fryer. That’s because, little to no oil is used, so there’s fewer calories. Finally, it won’t heat up your kitchen or leave a mess on your hands. In fact, our single basket is made with a ceramic non-stick coating, to make cleaning a breeze.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is perfect goes with the aesthetic of my kitchen works very good. Fits perfectly into my kitchen as far as measurements I have no complaints and the seller was amazing. Great communication and concern. I appreciate it.. would definitely recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is a well made and nice looking air fryer
reviews.reviewText: I bought the Paula Deen air fryer to replace an old air fryer that served me well, I really like the Paula Deen air fryer because has many nice features, the interior is made of shiny stainless steel to reflect the heat and ease to clean the fan is reasonably quiet cooks well, it’s a nice looking fryer,I made even easer to clean by using a Le Tauci ceramic liner together they work beautifully, very happy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This worked well for 6 months and stopped working. Customer Service replaced it under warrenty and had it to me in a couple of days. No hassle. Would buy it again no problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It is easy to use and even easier to clean. Great product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after 1 month
reviews.reviewText: It just stopped working about 1 month after we got it, thankfully it is still in the return window so I will be returning it. I think the heating element overheated and burned out, so if you are looking for an air fryer get one with overheat protection. This one was simple and easy to use, but that does not matter if it does not turn on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice air fryer
reviews.reviewText: Very nice. Green color matches our kitchen! Heats up quickly. Very versatile. Love the inside light. Nice compact size but decent size inside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars feedback from a late adopter
reviews.reviewText: I'm a late adopter to the air fryer phenomenon. Never had one or a confection oven before this. Being a late adopter to cooking tools stood me in good stead in skipping the Instapot, which I still think would have been redundant with the slow cooker. But my family probably would have been happy had I bought an air fryer sooner. After reading a zillion reviews, I went with this Paula Dean 10Q push button rather than the toaster oven style because I wanted something easy to clean and because our toaster oven is still working fine. I 100% agree with the reviews that this is easy to clean, which is, to me, its biggest advantage. Note that this is basically one big chamber with a removable metal tray or plate that is on legs that can be folded down. The main thing I learned from having this that I had not discovered from reviews is that the 10Q is not particularly functional. The reason the 10Q is superfluous is that the whole point of an air fryer is to maximize air circulation. This air fryer requires the metal plate to be below the food. So using the legs extended on the metal plate to allow air to circulate under the food is really how this is designed to be used. One could fold down the legs on the metal plate so it will rest on the bottom of the chamber, then pack food on top, but doing so will compromise air circulation. If you use the metal plate with the legs up, then you are limiting the amount you can cook to the 9x9" surface area of the metal plate. That said, it so far seems to me that I might as well have gone with a 4Q or 5Q depth with the same 9x9" surface area and saved myself some storage space in the unused height dimension. I might try using the metal plate on the floor of the chamber then packing in something like brussels sprouts or big pieces of cauliflower, so the shapes of the food will mean air can still circulate around the food, but I don't think I'll ever use the legs folded down for fish or chicken because putting food on the bottom means no air circulation from below, which will defeat the way the air fryer creates crispiness. My favorite thing so far has been brussels sprouts, followed by cauliflower: they come out substantially better than conventional roasting, though the recipes I have seen say to toss every 3 minutes for a 15 minute cook-cycle, and if I was willing to toss more often with roasting, despite the longer cook time, perhaps I could get closer. The crispy vegetables are the main benefit to the air fryer. So far, I prefer a broiler for chicken and fish, though I will try a few more times. Anyone who has said they cook their entire meal in an air fryer is probably cooking for a family of one or two (or perhaps using a toaster oven style, with which I have no experience): if you're only going to put the food on the plate with its legs up, to maximize air circulation, keep in mind that the 9x9" is the meaningful dimension so that you won't realistically be able to do more than 2 pounds of fish or chicken at a time. I thought I wanted push buttons rather than a dial, but don't find them particularly useful (I always use the air fryer setting anyway, and when I've followed recipes, the other buttons seem to be below the recommended heat). The dark blue exterior has more of a greenish undertone than a purplish undertone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It just stopped working!
reviews.reviewText: I love Paula, Dean and her products, my only dislike is I brought this air fryer and it only work one to two months and it’s just stopped working, the get started book states that it lasts for 2 to 5 years, but it only lasted one to two months and then you can’t get anything back so my money is just wasted. I love the mini look she has, but I will not be purchasing any more Pauline products..
Awesome product, great size for a family. The chicken comes out so crispy and juicy. Kale chips so easy and fast. Love it

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm in love with this amazing Air Fryer the size is perfect also looks very beautiful
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I sued it Since I got it and I love it

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after only a few uses and the seller refused to provide support.
reviews.reviewText: This fryer stopped working after only a few uses and after having it less than two months. The seller refused to provide support or warranty and was rude. Thankfully, Amazon refunded my purchase when the seller refused to do so. This seller is unprofessional, will not stand behind the product, and speaks as though integrity and customer service are foreign concepts. Do not purchase this product, if it fails, you will not be provided support.
